intro: Tetrorum pusillum, commonly known as the small tetraorus, is a small flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Its botanical features include a slender stem and a distinctive umbel-like inflorescence. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
